intro: Sopubia trifida var. ramosa, commonly known as the branched sopubia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy foliage and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
